Content:
Bleeding on birth control, particularly after orgasm? Uterine polyps?  
F20, USA
Medications: Started Loryna in August of 2023 
Medical history: Never have been sexually active with another partner. 

I have been on Loryna for a solid year and a few months now. I got sick this past February that triggered some breakthrough bleeding that lasted a while before I ended up skipping a placebo week and it kind of sorted itself out. 

I also finished my semester and was significantly less stressed. It was fine for a few months.


This past month I once again started spotting/lightly bleeding and it's been 2ish weeks. It’s not more than enough to use more than one pad a day. No where near enough for a tampon.  I skipped straight into the current pack I'm on now and I have been bleeding still.


Should I take the placebos at the end of this pack (4 pills) to give my body a bit of a break to bleed and then start again?


I will say these past few weeks I've taken the pill not as strict, where I can be several hours late. I've been so slammed and sometimes I forget to at work, school, when I'm studying, etc. so I am not sure if that has something to do with it?? I am also once again, stressed as hell.


On top of that, I am a little freaked out about the possibility of uterine polyps. I was bleeding a little already, but I noticed that when I masturbate (external with vibrator, usually 2ish orgasms) and then use the bathroom, it looks like I'm on my period. I am not sure if it's just because I exaggerated the bleeding I was already having, or if it's something to be really worried about. Google says uterine polyps and that’s really freaking me out. It usually stops soon after and returns to spotting. 


I'd appreciate any advice/recommendation as typically Loryna really works for me (no side effects, etc.

How long does Food poisoning last? Just got back from cancun and got food poisoning while there (YAY). I’m wondering whether this is normal or should I go to a clinic?

For Mods: 26F, 5’7 height and 135lbs.

Symptoms started on Tuesday with nausea. Wednesday night DIED. Thursday night DIED. Friday lightheadedness and mild death on flight at night. Saturday mild death and exhaustion. Today mild death and complete exhaustion.

Also all of this cramping has started a premature period by about 20 days lol.

How much longer? Is this normal or should I go to a clinic?

I’ve been able to keep food down since Friday evening and been taking electrolyte drinks.

Content:
Help walking like normal again Hi y’all, this past year of mine has been a literal hell.  I was in a car accident last year where I fractured ( all same side ) my fibula, dislocated my knee ( no idea about tendon damage, I know two minor tendons are still not in place yet ), dislocated my hip, fractured my pelvis, and cracked six ribs.  All of these were closed fractures.  X-rays show muscles in/around my knee have atrophied as a result of not being used for so long.  Both surgeons have cleared me to 100% weight bearing as tolerated.

I’ve been through physical therapy in acute rehab, a nursing home, and home health.  I’ve been trying my best to either stay moving or get help doing bedside physical therapy via friends and a printout a therapist gave me.

I’ve been dealing with foot drop and hypersensitivity ever since this started and it’s driving me nuts.  I have an AFO I wear and I “walk” with a walker, I’m working on using crutches.

I’m looking for ideas/options for me to walk more normally ( hopefully up/down stairs on my own ) and to get motion&feeling back in my foot.  The only present barrier I have would be my knee not bending past 50*, but I have a manipulation scheduled soon to crack or cut up scar tissue with out-patient soon after.

I’ll be happy to answer any questions, but holy shit do I want to walk again.
Message:
Hi there!

I truly admire your strength and determination through such a challenging recovery journey. It sounds like you've been putting in a tremendous amount of effort, and I want you to know that you're not alone in this. 

If you’re looking for new

Content:
UNSOLVED: Seeking Advice on Persistent Testicular Discomfort, Been suffering from years Hello everyone, it driving me crazy,

I've been experiencing an issue with discomfort in my testicles for the past two years, and I'm trying to understand what might be causing it. Here are some details about the situation:

* **Symptoms:** The discomfort (or "hitching") occurs whether I'm wearing clothes or not, but it seems to be worse with contact and friction. During sports, I often notice it at the beginning of the activity, but it doesn’t happen every time.
* **Variability:** Some days the discomfort is minimal, while on others, it can be quite pronounced.
* **Physical Examination:** I’ve checked for any apparent skin conditions or parasites, and my skin looks normal. I’ve also tried hydrating the area, but that doesn’t seem to alleviate the problem.
* **History:** This issue began when I was 15 years old, and I’m currently 17.

Based on my observations, I have a few theories about potential causes:

1. Dietary factors
2. Stress or anxiety
3. Possible allergic reactions (though I don’t think that’s likely)
4. An underlying condition that isn’t visually apparent
5. Something else entirely (probably cause i tried to test those previous ideas) 

  
I already saw a general practitioner, but he didn't notice anything, and it didn't lead to any progress. I have no idea what to do, and it's hard to focus in school when things are on fire.

  
I would greatly appreciate any insights or suggestions on what this could be or what steps I should take next. Thank you!

Content:
Now, sometimes extracting a tooth is what you need and dentists don’t want to do it. I had a dentist do a root canal (first one ever) and after that I had to go to the ER with the worst pain of my life (100x worse than kidney stones, nose job and childbirth lol). 

Turns out there was a small fracture at the base that doctors couldn’t easily see and they kept trying to repair the tooth, leading to more awful pain. I flew hours to see my childhood dentist and begged him to take the tooth out. He reluctantly did it and I can’t remember a happier/more intense feeling of relief lol. 

I promised myself to never need a root canal again and if I did, to get rid of the tooth instead. I rather eat soup forever than reliving that pain again.

Content:
I've had four root canals and never had any issues with pain afterwards myself, although two of them have since fractured because the tooth does get weaker.

One they were able to put a metal post in and put my bridge back on (which has stayed for a couple of years now), the other is currently still sitting unprotected in my mouth (there's almost no visible tooth left, it's almost flat along my gumline). No pain, though.

They keep telling me I should get an implant for it but I keep putting it off. And reading this article it doesn't help make me want to get that implant.

Anyway point being hopefully that one horrible root canal experience was a fluke and you won't have quite so bad of an experience with the next one, at least not with pain.

I've had way more issues with extracted teeth (because I needed to ruin more teeth to get a bridge put in, and that lead issues keeping those ruined anchor teeth clean enough) than I have had with root canaled teeth.
